goal.ch: 本課程旨在深入閱讀德希達的著作《論文字學》。德希達於此著作中，拆解西方文化傳統中受邏各斯中心支配下的文字符號、時間與空間，乃至於形上學的規範。這樣的規範，使得語言從屬於思想、文字又是語言的派生、寫作只是記錄，最後閱讀則需要溯及作者的意圖。亦即這些等級與不對等的關係，其實就是邏各斯中心影響下的結果。德希達在拆解這些傳統的同時，也以「補充」的概念，使得文本不再只有內部封閉的意義，而是在可能的文本中形成意指鏈，從而使得意義不斷增生。
goal.en: This course aims to provide an in-depth reading of Derrida‘s book “Of grammatology“. In this work, Derrida dismantles the literal symbols, time and space, and even metaphysical norms that are dominated by logos in the Western cultural tradition. Such norms make language subordinate to thought, writing is a derivative of language, writing is just a record, and reading in the end requires tracing back to the author‘s intention. That is to say, these hierarchical and unequal relationships are actually the result of the influence of the logocentrism. While deconstructing these traditions, Derrida also uses the concept of “supplement“ to make the text no longer have an internally closed meaning, but to form a chain of meanings in the possible text, thus increasing the meaning.
